channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two Keylocks attached to railing of a public space, 27th June
item.description:
There are two keylocks attached to the railing of the flowerbed located between Cumberland Street, Cumberland Court and Winchester Street. They look like those used for private short-term rentals, so we think they should not be attached to a public railing. Besides, if they have been attached there, rather than to the entrance of a house, they are probably from a non-authorised rental activity. We think they should be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winchester Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Scooter, 27th June
item.description:
This abandoned scooter is located in the same place where I have reported an abandoned caravan. Despite my earlier report, the issue persists and has now worsened. This scooter now has been dumped here for two weeks, with the registration number LR20 AUE. It is a Yamaha XMAX and has no tax or mot it has been expired since last year. The presence of both the scooter and the caravan is contributing to a growing issue of neglect and obstruction in the area. Please can this be investigated and the necessary action taken for the scooter and the caravan ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New tree leaning, 27th June
item.description:
Dear Sirs The new tree you planted last year (which now has leaves) outside on the public pathway between house numbers 58 and 60 Merlin Grove (BR3 3HU) is now leaning to one side. We are concerned it will not grow straight and will cause a problem later especially as our cars are parked next to said tree. Can you please rectify. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merlin Grove, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
